name: Bricks
description: Build your own Set with the use of Bricks. Bricks are represent the visual element on a page, like a button or a list of news items or the news items themselves. Choose which Bricks you deem useful from Legobox's Brick collection.
content: Build your own Set with the use of Bricks. Bricks are snippets of code that represent a visual element on a page, like a button or a list of news items or the news items themselves. Below you will find all Legobox's Bricks.

name: Sets
description: Sets determine the layout of your selection of Bricks. By telling the Set which Brick goes where, you are building the skeleton of a page. Legobox provides the toolkit to assemble Sets the way you like.
content: Sets determine the layout of your selection of Bricks. Combined with the right data, a Set can be used to create pages. Legobox has some predefined Sets to choose from listed below.

name: Themes
description: Legobox comes with three themes: 'Less == More', 'More OR Less' and 'FreeStyle'; and three different colors to be changed to whatever you like: a primary, secondary and tertiary color.
content: Legobox comes with three themes: 'Less == More', 'More OR Less' and 'FreeStyle'; and three different colors to be changed to whatever you like: a primary, secondary and tertiary color.
